comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Although there are words on those sashes they wear, they are virtually inscrutable. Could this jolly group be connected with the November, 1913, Mayoralty election in New York City, in which the Fusion ticket, led by John Puroy Mitchel, emerged victorious?

Might they be members of the "Women's Fusion League for Good Government"?
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4525448627/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Right, see article in the New-York tribune., October 28, 1913, Page 3, 4th column "FUSION WOMAN TO HOLD TAG DAY FOR MITCHEL"
